title: Woman's 'warning shot' strikes boyfriend
content:
A woman's intended warning shot ended up striking her boyfriend Friday evening, an arrest warrant said.
Police were dispatched to the 100 block of Circle Court in the Myrtle Hill neighborhood off of Ramsey Street at 11:51 p.m. They arrived and found that Jermaine Lewis, 35, of Fayetteville. had been shot. The warrant said Lewis was conscious and able to talk with officers before going to Cape Fear Valley Medical Center.
Lewis said he and his girlfriend Nichole Bianca West, 35, got into a fight at her home prior to the incident, the warrant said. West said that Lewis refused to leave, so she got out her .22-caliber rifle.
The warrant said West told police that she fired what was intended to be a warning shot to try to get Lewis to leave. However, that warning shot struck Lewis.
West, 35, was charged with assault with a deadly weapon causing serious injury. The warrant said no bail was set.
